intro: Homalium moto, commonly known as the red-flowered evergreen, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a small to medium-sized tree or shrub characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, bright red flowers that are highly attractive to birds and insects. Its fruits are small, fleshy berries that turn from green to orange as they mature. Homalium moto is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia and is often found in humid, shaded environments.
